original: Bärlin, Jean Albert Laurentius, civilingenjör, 0’s’karshamn, f. 9/9/93 i Gävle av pianoifabr. L. E. B. o. Augusta Äström. G. 19 m. Sigrid Nilsson. Barn: Curt f. 20, Rickard 22, Marianne 28, Gunilla 43. — Stud:ex. i Gävle 13, utex. fr. KTH (K) 16. Anst v. KTH mat :provn lanst. 16-17, v. Reymiershodmisiinst. 17-19, v. Rey-mersliolms Gamla Ind. A-B sed. 19, varav v. fo^sfatfabr. o. kopparv. i Häl-’sing-^b. 19-39 o. v. kopparv. i Oskarshamn s€d. 39. Led. av arb :lösh :komm. i Hälsingb. 29-39, remh :istyr. där 30-39, aff:verks-styr. 32-39, löne- o. avtalsnd 35-39. I 0’skarsham’n l-ed. av istadsfuUm. 0. drätstedkamm. sed. 43. Styr iled. i Tekn; fören. i Häl’siingb. 28-29 o. 31-30, sekr. o. kassör där 25-31, ordf. i Oskarshamns ’ing:fören. sed. 45. Hob-bies: friluftsliv, tennis.
translated: Bärlin, Jean Albert Laurentius, civil engineer, born on September 9, 1893 in Gävle, son of piano manufacturer L.E.B. and Augusta Äström. Married to Sigrid Nilsson since 1919 with four children: Curt born in 1920, Rickard in 1922, Marianne in 1928, and Gunilla in 1943. He graduated from Gävle high school in 1913 and from KTH (K) in 1916. He was employed by KTH as a materials testing examiner from 1916 to 1917, by Reymier's Mill Institute from 1917 to 1919, and by Reymersholm's Old Ind. A-B since 1919, including as a phosphate and copper manufacturer in Hälsingland from 1919 to 1939, and as a copper manufacturer in Oskarshamn since 1939. He was a member of the unemployment committee in Hälsingland from 1929 to 1939, a board member from 1930 to 1939, on the supervisory board from 1932 to 1939, and on the wage and contract negotiation committee from 1935 to 1939. In Oskarshamn, he was a member of the city planning committee and the finance committee from 1943. He was a board member of the Technical Society in Hälsingland from 1928 to 1929 and from 1931 to 1932, and its secretary and treasurer from 1925 to 1931. He was the chairman of the Oskarshamns Engineering Society since 1945. His hobbies included outdoor activities and tennis.

structured.name: Jean Albert Laurentius Bärlin
structured.description: Jean Albert Laurentius Bärlin was a civil engineer born in Gävle, Sweden on September 9, 1893. He was married to Sigrid Nilsson and had four children. Bärlin graduated from Gävle high school in 1913 and from KTH (K) in 1916. He held various positions in his employment history including Materials Testing Examiner at KTH, and served on several committees and boards related to unemployment, supervisory, engineering societies and city planning. Bärlin enjoyed outdoor activities and tennis for his hobbies.
